data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can only fall forward if you always face forward. You can not fall backwards if you always face right. The starting point is in front of you. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 4 steps, turn around, and return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You are taking 4 steps to turn around and then 6 steps to complete the circle. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Once the 7 steps are complete, you should be back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

On the first day, take 10 steps. Turn left. On the next day, take 5 steps. On the last day, take 10 steps, turn left, take 9 steps and take 3 steps. So, the answer is no.

Take 7 steps to turn around and back around. Take 7 steps to turn left, take 7 steps to turn right and take 7 more steps to turn around. So, the answer is yes.

If you are always facing forward, you cannot take any step. To take 6 steps backward, you first need to take 5 steps backward. To take 1 step backward, you first need to take 6 steps backward. To take 2 steps left, you first need to take 2 steps left. So, the answer is No.

Whenever you exit the map, you return to the starting point. The instructions point back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

The first step to the starting point is to always face forward and facing ahead. The second step is to take 3 steps forward at the same time. The third step is to take 1 step right at the same time. Therefore, the answer is Yes.

Turning around once makes back to start. Turning around twice makes back to start. Turning around a full dozen times makes back to start. It is very tricky to make the back to start from the starting point. So, the answer is no.
